pages.title: Demonstrations
pages.summary: A series of increasingly violent street demonstrations through December.

pages.title: Suicide protestor dies
pages.summary: A Tunisian graduate whose attempted suicide set off violent protests over unemployment across the North Africa nation has died.

pages.title: Ousting of president
pages.summary: Ben Ali fled into exile in Saudi Arabia, ending his 23 years in power. A state of emergency was declared and a caretaker coalition government was created.

person.name: Zine El Abidine Ben Ali
person.summary: Led Tunisia for 23 years before stepping down in January 2011 amid an unprecedented wave of street protests.

pages.title: Government resuffle
pages.summary: As a result of continued daily protests, Prime Minister Mohamed Ghannouchi reshuffled the government, removing all former RCD members other than himself.

person.name: Mohamed Ghannouchi
person.summary: The former Prime Minister of Tunisia and was self-proclaimed acting President of the country for a few hours starting 14 January 2011, under Article 56 of the Constitution of Tunisia.
